Description: Marl pottery vase, of late wavy-handle type, with nearly cylindrical shape, walls swelling to slight shoulder, slight inset neck, strongly everted roll-over rim, and applied band of clay with impressed pie-crust decoration around shoulder..
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 20; cf pl. xxxiii.55 Like Wavy handled W56A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery. H122 marked on base.
Condition: poor (surface worn from salt, rim chipped)
